events.title: Viking Raid on Lindisfarne
events.description: Norse Viking raiders attacked the monastery at Lindisfarne, off the northeast coast of England, marking the beginning of the Viking Age in Europe.
events.significance: This event signaled the start of extensive Viking raids and influence across Europe, affecting political and cultural landscapes.

events.title: John Cabot Sighted North America
events.description: Explorer John Cabot, sailing under the English flag, sighted land in North America, believed to be Newfoundland.
events.significance: This expedition paved the way for future English claims and colonization in the Americas.

events.title: Battle of Mont Sorrel Begins
events.description: The Battle of Mont Sorrel, a significant World War I battle between Canadian and German forces near Ypres, Belgium, commenced.
events.significance: This battle was notable for intense trench warfare and highlighted the sacrifices of Canadian forces during WWI.

events.title: Berlin Airlift Begins
events.description: The Western Allies initiated the Berlin Airlift to circumvent the Soviet blockade of West Berlin.
events.significance: The airlift symbolized Western commitment to West Berlin during the early Cold War, showcasing logistical ingenuity and political resolve.

events.title: World Health Organization Declares Haiti Cholera Outbreak Over
events.description: WHO officially declared the end of the cholera outbreak in Haiti that began after the 2010 earthquake.
events.significance: Marked a major milestone in public health recovery efforts in the aftermath of a devastating natural disaster.
